title: Publications
text: My research focuses on Science of Science, Complex Networks, and Academic Career Development. I use data-driven approaches to understand how mentorship, team size, and network structures affect scientific survival and success in the life-course perspective. Recently, my research has also expanded to include the evolution of cross-disciplinary knowledge.

I will be a tenure-track assistant professor at the Data Management Innovation Research Center, Nanjing University, Suzhou Campus. Previously, I was a postdoctoral researcher in the Department of Statistics and Data Science, Southern University of Science and Technology (July 2023–December 2025). My research expertise lies in Science of Science, Complex Networks, and Scientometrics. I am particularly interested in the career development paths of young scholars and the mechanisms of academic mentorship.
My recent research, published in Nature Human Behaviour, explores how academic group size influences mentee’s scientific career. This work has been highlighted by Nature News: “How a PhD student’s lab size affects their chance of future academic success”.

title: Join Us
text:
We are currently looking for highly motivated Master’s and Ph.D. students to join our research group starting in 2027.

Research Directions
Our group focuses on data-driven studies of scientific systems, with three core research directions:

Academic career trajectories of early-career researchers
We investigate the evolution of academic careers of young scholars and the underlying mechanisms shaping their long-term development and success, with a particular focus on both individual-level dynamics and team-based processes, such as mentorship, collaboration structures, and group organization.
Quantifying the impact of artificial intelligence on disciplinary communication and knowledge diffusion
We study how AI technologies influence interdisciplinary communication, knowledge dissemination, and the structure of scientific exchange across disciplines.
Data-driven modeling of scientific discovery and innovation processes
We develop computational and statistical models to understand and characterize patterns of scientific discovery, innovation, and knowledge production using large-scale scholarly data.

Students with interests in Science of Science, AI and science, network science, or data-driven modeling of scientific systems are especially encouraged to apply.


Prospective Master’s and Ph.D. Students (2027 Intake)
Applicants with a strong background in mathematics, statistics, computer science, physics, data science, or related fields will be well suited for the group. Prior experience with Python, SQL, machine learning, or large-scale data analysis is a plus, but not strictly required.


Pre-Master and Pre-Doctoral Opportunities
Students planning to apply for the 2027 Master’s or Ph.D. programs are welcome to contact me in advance to explore opportunities to join the group as pre-master’s or pre-doctoral researchers.
During the pre-master / pre-doctoral period, students will: - Participate in ongoing research projects - Receive close research mentorship and training - Gain hands-on experience with real-world research data - Be supported in preparing for graduate applications
Appropriate research stipends will be provided based on individual engagement and project involvement.


How to Apply
If you are interested, please send an email to
yanmeng0608@outlook.com
with: - A brief CV - Academic transcripts (if available) - A short description of your research interests and background
Early contact is strongly encouraged.

We aim to build an inclusive, collaborative, and intellectually open research environment, and we welcome students who are curious, self-motivated, and eager to explore data-driven research questions at the frontier of science.
